Serialized Form

  • Package edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.FinalProject

    • Class edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.FinalProject.AddAmmoPowerUp extends Item implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      1L

    • Class edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.FinalProject.GameOverException extends Exception implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      1L

    • Class edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.FinalProject.GUIClass extends JFrame implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      1L

      • Serialized Fields

        • WINDOW_WIDTH

          int WINDOW_WIDTH

        • WINDOW_HEIGHT

          int WINDOW_HEIGHT

        • titleImage

          ImageIcon titleImage
          This is an object that uses the image that will display at the top of the window, showing the game's title, "Rise of the Death Star."

        • mapGrid

          JLabel[][] mapGrid
          This is a two-dimensional array of JLabels, where each JLabel represents one square of the map grid for display.

        • title

          JLabel title
          This is a JLabel that displays the titleImage at the top of the screen.

        • name

          JLabel name
          This is a JLabel that display's the Player's name at the top of the player information area on the left side of the screen ("Boba Fett").

        • missionLine1

          JLabel missionLine1
          This is a JLabel that displays the first line of the sentence describing the Player's mission in the game.

        • missionLine2

          JLabel missionLine2
          This is a JLabel that displays the second line of the sentence describing the Player's mission in the game.

        • livesDisplay

          JLabel livesDisplay
          This is a JLabel that displays the value of the Player object's lives field in the information area on the left side of the screen.

        • invincDisplay

          JLabel invincDisplay
          This is a JLabel that displays the value of the Player object's invincibilityCounter field in the information area on the left side of the screen.

        • bulletsDisplay

          JLabel bulletsDisplay
          This is a JLabel that displays the value of the Player's Gun object's ammo field in the information area on the left side of the screen.

        • topB

          JLabel topB
          This is a JLabel that is simply used to display a border above the map on the screen, to make it clearer where the map's display ends.

        • rightB

          JLabel rightB
          This is a JLabel that is simply used to display a border to the right of the map on the screen, to make it clearer where the map's display ends.

        • leftB

          JLabel leftB
          This is a JLabel that is simply used to display a border to the left of the map on the screen, to make it clearer where the map's display ends.

        • bottomB

          JLabel bottomB
          This is a JLabel that is simply used to display a border below the map on the screen, to make it clearer where the map's display ends.

        • topBor

          ImageIcon topBor
          This is an ImageIcon that uses an image for the top border for the display.

        • rightBor

          ImageIcon rightBor
          This is an ImageIcon that uses an image for the right border for the display.

        • leftBor

          ImageIcon leftBor
          This is an ImageIcon that uses an image for the left border for the display.

        • bottomBor

          ImageIcon bottomBor
          This is an ImageIcon that uses an image for the bottom border for the display.

        • moveButton

          JButton moveButton
          This is the button that the user will press to move. It will hold a new MoveListener object. It will only appear when the user has the option to move.

        • lookButton

          JButton lookButton
          This is the button that the user will press to look. It will hold a new LookListener object. It will only appear when the user has the option to look.

        • shootButton

          JButton shootButton
          This is the button that the user will press to shoot. It will hold a new ShootListener object. It will only appear when the user has the option to shoot.

        • saveButton

          JButton saveButton
          This is the button that the user will press to save the game. It will hold a new SaveListener object. It will only appear when the user has the option to save.

        • quitButton

          JButton quitButton
          This is the button that the user will press to quit the game. It will hold a new QuitListener object. It will only appear when the user has the option to quit.

        • up

          JButton up
          This is the button that the user will press to do an action upward. It will hold a new DirectionListener object. It will only appear when the user has chosen to move, look, or shoot.

        • down

          JButton down
          This is the button that the user will press to do an action downward. It will hold a new DirectionListener object. It will only appear when the user has chosen to move, look, or shoot.

        • left

          JButton left
          This is the button that the user will press to do an action left. It will hold a new DirectionListener object. It will only appear when the user has chosen to move, look, or shoot.

        • right

          JButton right
          This is the button that the user will press to do an action right. It will hold a new DirectionListener object. It will only appear when the user has chosen to move, look, or shoot.

        • none

          JButton none
          This is the button that the user will press to move in no direction at all, or to stay still for a turn. It will hold a new DirectionListener object. It will only appear when the user has chosen to move, because movement is the only action that can be done in no direction at all while choosing that option.

        • yesButton

          JButton yesButton
          This is the button that the user will press to save before quitting when the user has chosen to quit the game and is prompted with the options "Yes" or "No." It will hold a new SaveBeforeQuitListener object. It will only appear when the user has chosen to quit the game.

        • noButton

          JButton noButton
          This is the button that the user will press to quit without saving when the user has chosen to quit the game and is prompted with the options "Yes" or "No." It will hold a new SaveBeforeQuitListener object. It will only appear when the user has chosen to quit the game.

        • mainText

          JTextArea mainText
          This is a text area that will display the text messages letting the user know what has just happened - such as when they have died or picked up a powerup item. It displays 5 lines at a time and will appear below the map (each new line displayed will print at the bottom, pushing all of the old messages upward). It will be visible the entire time the GUI is active.

        • layout

          SpringLayout layout
          This is the layout used for managing the positions of all of the visible objects used in the GUI window.

        • mainPanel

          JPanel mainPanel
          This is the JPanel container used to hold all of the visible objects used in the GUI window.

        • biggerFont

          Font biggerFont
          This is the font used for display in the buttons and labels. Because these buttons and labels are needed more frequently - and because they appear in all different locations, unlike the more central mainText JTextArea - they should have a bigger, easier-to-read font.

        • saveState

          Save saveState
          This is the Serializable object used to either save or load the game. It will hold all of the parameters of the game that need to be maintained: the player, the enemies, the items, and whether or not the game is a debugging or non-debugging game (this choice cannot be changed, so it should be kept after saving/loading).

        • gameMap

          Map gameMap
          This is the Map used to represent all of the squares on the game grid.

        • user

          Player user
          This is the Player representing the character controlled by the user.

        • masters

          Jedi[] masters
          This is an array of all of the enemies (the "Jedi") that antagonize the user throughout the game.

        • invinc

          InvincibilityPowerUp invinc
          This is the object representing the (@link Item} that the user may pick up if they walk onto giving the player temporary invincibility.

        • radar

          RadarPowerUp radar
          This is the object representing the Item that the user may pick up if they walk onto that prints a message revealing the holocron's location on the grid.

        • addAmmo

          AddAmmoPowerUp addAmmo
          This is the object representing the Item that the user may pick up if they walk onto that adds one to the field of the Player's Gun object, ammo.

        • holo

          Holocron holo
          This is the object representing the Item that represents the game's primary objective; the user may pick it up to win and end the game.

        • isDebug

          boolean isDebug
          This is a field keeping track of whether this is a game that the user chose to run in debug mode or not.

        • action

          int action
          This is a field that registers which action the user chose to do when the pressed the corresponding buttons to either move, look, or shoot. It will be used in the GUIClass.DirectionListener class, so that the method within it knows both with direction and which action the user has chosen. A value of 1 represents a decision to move, a value of 2 represents a decision to look, and a value of 3 represents a decision to shoot.

        • lookDirection

          int lookDirection
          This is a field that registers which direction the user has looked on that turn. A value of 1 represents up, a value of 2 represents right, a value of 3 represents down, a value of 4 represents left, and a value of 5 represents "none" (i.e. the user has chosen to stay in place).

        • hasShot

          boolean hasShot
          This is a field that registers whether the user has shot already on their turn. It will reset itself to false at the start of each turn, and it will set itself to true just after the user shoots. This field is necessary to stop the user from shooting twice in one turn.

        • messageLines

          String[] messageLines
          This is an array of Strings that are used to hold the information which is printed in the JTextArea, mainText.

        • gameEnded

          boolean gameEnded
          This is a boolean field that keeps track of whether the game has ended. If the game has ended, there are no more options displayed, and so the game does not present the user with any more buttons.

        • hasDied

          boolean hasDied
          This is a boolean field that keeps track of whether the user has died. It is used by the static method in game, mastersStab.

    • Class edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.FinalProject.Gun extends Object implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      1L

      • Serialized Fields

        • ammo

          int ammo
          ammo is an integer representing the amount of bullets in the Gun, which will be used in determining whether the Gun can or cannot shoot.

    • Class edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.FinalProject.Holocron extends Item implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      1L

    • Class edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.FinalProject.InvincibilityPowerUp extends Item implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      1L

      • Serialized Fields

        • INVINCIBILITY_AMOUNT

          int INVINCIBILITY_AMOUNT
          This is the amount of turns the player can be invincible to the stabs of the Jedi. It is a final int so that we can easily change the amount of turns if we ever needed to.

    • Class edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.FinalProject.Item extends Object implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      1L

      • Serialized Fields

        • location

          int[] location
          This field is for setting the location of each Item object within the boundaries of the map generated by the game.

    • Class edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.FinalProject.Jedi extends Person implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      1L

      • Serialized Fields

        • chasing

          boolean chasing
          The value that determines whether the jedi is chasing Player

    • Class edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.FinalProject.Person extends Object implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      1L

      • Serialized Fields

        • location

          int[] location
          (@link location) is a location on an x and y grid, where x is index 0 and y is the index 1.

    • Class edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.FinalProject.Player extends Person implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      1L

      • Serialized Fields

        • blaster

          Gun blaster
          This is the gun that the player will use to try to stop the Jedi from attacking. The blaster will start with only one shot, so the player must use the shot wisely.

        • lives

          int lives
          This determines how many lives the player has left. It will be from 0 <= x <= 4. When it reaches 0, the game will end.

        • invincibilityCounter

          int invincibilityCounter
          This will keep track of how many turns the player is invincible to Jedi attacks.

    • Class edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.FinalProject.RadarPowerUp extends Item implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      1L

    • Class edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.FinalProject.Save extends Object implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      1L

      • Serialized Fields

        • thePlayer

          Player thePlayer
          The single necessary Player object (which is also of type Character that will store all of the data for the player once the game is saved. This will include whether each Area contains an Item object or Person object in it.

        • theJedi

          Jedi[] theJedi
          enemies will be an array of size 6 of Jedi objects. This will be necessary to keep track of the location of each of these enemies.

        • theItems

          Item[] theItems
          This will be an array of size 4, which will hold the InvincibilityPowerUp, the AddAmmoPowerUp, the RadarPowerUp, and the Holocron.

        • debug

          boolean debug
          This value will be used to save wheter the game was running in debug or not
